title.narrative: Saving Mothers' and Infants' Life Proejct

description.narrative: Improve community awareness and response to maternal health: The project is providing information on health care needs, government service provisions and promotes behavior change among mothers and entire communities by strengthening and/or activating community-based groups, such as mothers groups, FCHVs and Health Facility Operation Management Committees (HFOMCs). Improve the quality of pregnancy and delivery care services at local health facilities. Training/refresher courses on birth preparedness to FCHVs and health workers; renovate and provide essential equipment and supplies to birthing centers in both districts and HFOMCs is higher to upgrade and strengthen birthing centers at the sub health post and health post levels; establish and/or improve referral systems between communities, local health facilities and district service providers; train health providers to conduct normal and complicated birth deliveries (as per the government’s mandate on skilled birth attendants). Promote and strengthen health governance, accountability systems, advocacy and resource mobilization. To improve local health governance and service quality by promoting responsibility, accountability, transparency and predictability in health services.
Pregnant mothers, lactating mothers and newborn childs are the main impact group of the project

Saving Mothers’ and Infants’ Lives (SMILE) project is focusing on empowering communities, improving local health governance and strengthening maternal health services in the weakest parts of the two districts.
